briefdescription.para: Refinement level per-USD-prim and fallback.
Populate HdxSelection for given path (root) and instanceIndex.

detaileddescription.para: If indexPath is an instancer and instanceIndex is ALL_INSTANCES (-1), all instances will be selected.
Note: if usdPath points to a gprim, "instanceIndex" (if provided) is assumed to be the hydra-computed instance index returned from picking code.

If usdPath points to a point instancer, "instanceIndex" is assumed to be the instance of the point instancer to selection highlight (e.g. instance N of the protoIndices array). This would correspond to returning one of the tuples from GetScenePrimPath's "instancerContext".
In any other case, the interpretation of instanceIndex is undefined.

briefdescription.para: Map from USD prim path to refine level.
Cached/pre-fetched primvar descriptors.
Usd binding.
The current time from which the delegate will read data.
Path to the camera that its shutter will be used for time samples.
Enable custom shading of prims.
Enable lights found in the usdscene.
Synchronizes the delegate state for the given request vector.
Populates the rootPrim in the HdRenderIndex.
Populates the rootPrim in the HdRenderIndex, excluding all paths in the excludedPrimPaths, as well as their prim children.
Sets the current time from which data will be read by the delegate.

detaileddescription.para: Changing the current time immediately triggers invalidation in the HdChangeTracker. Redundantly setting the time to its existing value is a no-op and will not trigger invalidation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current time.
Apply a relative offset to the current time.

detaileddescription.para: This has no effect in the case of the default USD timecode.

briefdescription.para: Applies any scene edits which have been queued up by notices from USD.
Returns the refinement level that is used when prims have no explicit level set.

detaileddescription.para: The refinement level indicates how many iterations to apply when subdividing subdivision surfaces or other refinable primitives.
Refinement level is always in the range [0,8].

briefdescription.para: Sets the fallback refinement level to level, triggers dirty refine level bit to be set on all Rprims that don't have explicit refine levels set.

detaileddescription.para: Level is expected to be in the range [0,8], where 0 indicates no refinement.

briefdescription.para: Removes any explicit refine level set for the given USD prim.

detaileddescription.para: Marks dirty if a change in level occurs.

briefdescription.para: Sets an explicit refinement level for the given USD prim.

detaileddescription.para: If no level is explicitly set, the fallback is used; see GetRefineLevelFallback(). If setting an explicit level does not change the effective level, no dirty bit is set.

briefdescription.para: Returns the fallback repr name.
Sets the fallback repr name.

detaileddescription.para: Note that currently UsdImagingDelegate doesn't support per-prim repr.

briefdescription.para: Returns the fallback cull style.
Sets the fallback cull style.
Sets the root transform for the entire delegate, which is applied to all render prims generated.

detaileddescription.para: Setting this value will immediately invalidate existing rprim transforms.

briefdescription.para: Returns the root transform for the entire delegate.
Sets the root visibility for the entire delegate, which is applied to all render prims generated.

detaileddescription.para: Setting this value will immediately invalidate existing rprim visibility.

briefdescription.para: Returns the root visibility for the entire delegate.
Sets the root instancer id for the entire delegate, which is used as a fallback value for GetInstancerId.
Returns the root instancer id for the entire delegate.
Set the list of paths that must be invised.
Set transform value overrides on a set of paths.
Sets display of prims with purpose "render".
Sets display of prims with purpose "proxy".
Sets display of prims with purpose "guide".
Returns whether draw modes are enabled.
Enables custom shading on prims.
Enables lights found in the usdscene.
Set the window policy on all scene cameras.

detaileddescription.para: This comes from the application.

briefdescription.para: Sets display of unloaded prims as bounding boxes.

detaileddescription.para:
Unloaded prims will need to satisfy one of the following set of conditions in order to see them:
The prim is a UsdGeomBoundable with an authored 'extent' attribute.
The prim is a UsdPrim.IsModel() and has an authored 'extentsHint' attribute (see UsdGeomModelAPI::GetExtentsHint). Effective only for delegates that support draw modes (see GetUsdDrawModesEnabled()).

briefdescription.para: Setup for the shutter open and close to be used for motion sampling.
Returns the current interval that will be used when using the sample* API in the scene delegate.
Returns the render tag that will be used to bucket prims during render pass bucketing.
Gets the topological mesh data for a given prim.
Gets the topological curve data for a given prim.
Gets the subdivision surface tags (sharpness, holes, etc).
Gets the axis aligned bounds of a prim.

detaileddescription.para: The returned bounds are in the local space of the prim (transform is yet to be applied) and should contain the bounds of any child prims.
The returned bounds does not include any displacement that might occur as the result of running shaders on the prim.

briefdescription.para: Returns the object space transform, including all parent transforms.
Returns the authored visible state of the prim.
Returns the doubleSided state for the given prim.
Returns the cullstyle for the given prim.
Gets the explicit display style for the given prim, if no refine level is explicitly set, the fallback is returned; also see GetRefineLevelFallback().
Returns the model draw mode object for the given prim.
Returns a named value.
Returns a named primvar value.

detaileddescription.para: If *outIndices is not nullptr and the primvar has indices, it will return the unflattened primvar and set *outIndices to the primvar's associated indices, clearing the array if the primvar is not indexed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the coordinate system bindings, or a nullptr if none are bound.
Returns the authored repr (if any) for the given prim.
Returns the prim categories.
Returns the categories for all instances in the instancer.
Returns descriptors for all primvars of the given interpolation type.
Gets the extracted indices array of the prototype id used in the instancer.

detaileddescription.para: example instances: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 protoypes: A, B, A, A, B, C
GetInstanceIndices(A) : [0, 2, 3] GetInstanceIndices(B) : [1, 4] GetInstanceIndices(C) : [5] GetInstanceIndices(D) : []

briefdescription.para: Returns the instancer transform.
Returns the parent instancer of the given rprim or instancer.
Returns a list of prototypes of this instancer.

detaileddescription.para: The intent is to let renderers cache instance indices by giving them a complete set of prims to call GetInstanceIndices(instancer, prototype) on. XXX: This is currently unused, but may be used in the future.

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &id, size_t maxNumSamples, float *times, GfMatrix4d *samples) override
memberdef.name: SampleTransform

briefdescription.para: Store up to maxSampleCount transform samples in *sampleValues.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the union of the authored samples and the boundaries of the current camera shutter interval. If this number is greater than maxSampleCount, you might want to call this function again to get all the authored data. Sample times are relative to the scene delegate's current time.
GetTransform()

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &instancerId, size_t maxSampleCount, float *times, GfMatrix4d *samples) override
memberdef.name: SampleInstancerTransform

briefdescription.para: Store up to maxSampleCount transform samples in *sampleValues.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the union of the authored samples and the boundaries of the current camera shutter interval. If this number is greater than maxSampleCount, you might want to call this function again to get all the authored data. Sample times are relative to the scene delegate's current time.
GetInstancerTransform()

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &id, TfToken const &key, size_t maxNumSamples, float *times, VtValue *samples) override
memberdef.name: SamplePrimvar

briefdescription.para: Store up to maxSampleCount primvar samples in *samplesValues.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the union of the authored samples and the boundaries of the current camera shutter interval. If this number is greater than maxSampleCount, you might want to call this function again to get all the authored data.
Sample values that are array-valued will have a size described by the HdPrimvarDescriptor as applied to the toplogy.

For example, this means that a mesh that is fracturing over time will return samples with the same number of points; the number of points will change as the scene delegate is resynchronized to represent the scene at a time with different topology.
Sample times are relative to the scene delegate's current time.

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &id, TfToken const &key, size_t maxNumSamples, float *times, VtValue *samples, VtIntArray *indices) override
memberdef.name: SampleIndexedPrimvar

briefdescription.para: SamplePrimvar() for getting an unflattened primvar and its indices.

detaileddescription.para: If *sampleIndices is not nullptr and the primvar has indices, it will return unflattened primvar samples in *sampleValues and the primvar's sampled indices in *sampleIndices, clearing the *sampleIndices array if the primvar is not indexed.

briefdescription.para: Returns the material ID bound to the rprim rprimId.
Returns a single value for a given camera and parameter.

detaileddescription.para: See HdCameraTokens for the list of paramters.

briefdescription.para: Returns the scene address of the prim corresponding to the given rprim/instance index.

detaileddescription.para:
This is designed to give paths in scene namespace, rather than hydra namespace, so it always strips the delegate ID. Deprecated
use GetScenePrimPaths

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &rprimId, std::vector< int > instanceIndices, std::vector< HdInstancerContext > *instancerContexts=nullptr) override
memberdef.name: GetScenePrimPaths

briefdescription.para: A vectorized version of GetScenePrimPath that allows the prim adapter to amortize expensive calculations across a number of path evaluations in a single call.

detaileddescription.para: Note that only a single rprimId is supported. This allows this call to be forwarded directly to a single prim adapter rather than requiring a lot of data shuffling.

briefdescription.para: For the given computation id, returns a list of inputs which will be requested from the scene delegate using the Get() method.

detaileddescription.para: See GetExtComputationInputDescriptors and GetExtComputationOutpuDescriptors for descriptions of other computation inputs and outputs.

briefdescription.para: For the given computation id, returns a list of computation input descriptors.

detaileddescription.para: See HdExtComputationInputDecriptor

briefdescription.para: For the given computation id, returns a list of computation output descriptors.

detaileddescription.para: See HdExtComputationOutputDescriptor

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of primvar names that should be bound to a generated output from an ExtComputation for the given prim id and interpolation mode.

detaileddescription.para: Binding information is obtained through GetExtComputationPrimvarDesc() Returns a structure describing source information for a primvar that is bound to an ExtComputation. See HdExtComputationPrimvarDesc for the expected information to be returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns a single value for a given computation id and input token.

detaileddescription.para: The token may be a computation input or a computation config parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &computationId, TfToken const &input, size_t maxSampleCount, float *sampleTimes, VtValue *sampleValues) override
memberdef.name: SampleExtComputationInput

briefdescription.para: Return up to maxSampleCount samples for a given computation id and input token.

detaileddescription.para: The token may be a computation input or a computation config parameter. Returns the union of the authored samples and the boundaries of the current camera shutter interval. If this number is greater than maxSampleCount, you might want to call this function again to get all the authored data.

briefdescription.para: Returns the kernel source assigned to the computation at the path id.

detaileddescription.para: If the string is empty the computation has no GPU kernel and the CPU callback should be used.

briefdescription.para: Requests the scene delegate run the ExtComputation with the given id.

detaileddescription.para: The context contains the input values that delegate requested through GetExtComputationInputNames().
The scene delegate is expected to set each output identified by GetExtComputationOutputNames() on the context.
Hydra may invoke the computation on a different thread from what HdEngine::Execute() was called on. It may also invoke many computations in parallel.

briefdescription.para: Convert the given Hydra ID to a UsdImaging cache path, by stripping the scene delegate prefix.

detaileddescription.para: The UsdImaging cache path is the same as a USD prim path, except for instanced prims, which get a name-mangled encoding.

memberdef.argsstring: (HdSelection::HighlightMode const &highlightMode, const SdfPath &usdPath, int instanceIndex, HdSelectionSharedPtr const &result)
memberdef.name: PopulateSelection

briefdescription.para: Returns true if usdPath is included in invised path list.
For each delegate in delegates, sets the current time from which data wil be read to the corresponding time in times.

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to calling SetTime on each delegate individually. However, this method will try to parallelize certain operations, making it potentially more efficient.

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &id, TfToken const &key, size_t maxNumSamples, float *times, VtValue *samples, VtIntArray *indices)
memberdef.name: _SamplePrimvar

memberdef.argsstring: (SdfPath const &usdPath, TfTokenVector const &changedPrimInfoFields, _FlattenedDependenciesCacheMap const &cache, UsdImagingIndexProxy *proxy, SdfPathSet *allTrackedVariabilityPaths)
memberdef.name: _RefreshUsdObject

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the given prim is visible, taking into account inherited visibility values.

detaileddescription.para: Inherited values are strongest, Usd has no notion of "super vis/invis".

briefdescription.para: Helper method for filtering discovered primvar names.
The primary translation layer between the Hydra (Hd) core and the Usd scene graph.
